text: Everett Raymond Kinstler (August 5, 1926 - May 26, 2019) was an American portrait artist. He painted official portraits of businesspeople and also Presidents of the United States. He painted portraits for Gerald Ford and Ronald Reagan."Biography" . Retrieved 23 June 2007. ==Life== Kinstler was born in New York in 1926.Kinstler, Everett Raymond at Artcysclopedia.com He studied at the Art Students League of New York and taught there between 1969 and 1974. He died on May 26, 2019 of a short-illness at the age of 92.The Passing of Everett Raymond KinstlerEverett Raymond Kinstler - RIP ==Awards== * Elected into the National Academy of Design, in 1970 * Copley Medal from the Smithsonian National Portrait Gallery, in 1999 * Inkpot Award, in 2006 ==Gallery== |Portrait of Ronald Reagan |Portrait of Gerald Ford File:White Princess 3.jpg |Graphic art for White Princess of the Jungle File:Strange Worlds 3.jpg |Graphic art for Strange Worlds File:Kaanga 01 IW.jpg |Graphic art for Kaanga ==References== ==Other websites== *Official site Category:1926 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American painters Category:American comics artists Category:Educators from New York (state) Category:Artists from New York (state)
title: Everett Kinstler
